name: containerboard production, fluting medium, recycled | containerboard, fluting medium | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6640/documentation

This dataset has been extrapolated from respective regional geographies (RER). Wellenstoff is a grade of corrugated base paper, which forms the corrugated middle layer in the production of corrugated board, where is covered between two outer layers of linerboard (e.g. kraftliner or testliner). According to the common sector terminology, “wellenstoff” or “recycled medium” is made from recycled material, i.e. uses recovered paper as raw material as opposed to “semichemical fluting”, which is used interchangeably with wellenstoff but is made from virgin material.;Mind that this dataset is identical to the production testliner. FEFCO (2021) reports weighted average values of in- and outputs over the testliner and wellenstoff, since there are few differences between these grades. For this reason, also the calculated emissions resulting from fuel consumption are identical for wellenstoff and testliner.;Data for the production of testliner and wellenstoff were provided by the industry association CCB (Cepi ContainerBoard). The data for the production of Testliner and Wellenstoff were collected from European mills, together producing about 71% (17084104 tonnes) of the total annual production of corrugated base papers from recovered paper in Europe in 2020. The mills contributing with data are located in Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Denmark, France, Germany, Hungary, Italy, the Netherlands, Poland, Romania, Serbia, Spain, Sweden and the United Kingdom. Thereby each mill has an annual production volume of about 70 000 – 1 250 000 tonnes net saleable paper product (FEFCO, 2021). FEFCO. 2021. European Database for Corrugated Board Life Cycle Studies 2018. Reference(s): https://www.fefco.org/sites/default/files/documents/2022-07-07_FEFCO%20LCA%202021.pdf, last accessed March 2023;In FEFCO 2021 fuel consumption and the related emission to air include only steam and net electricity used on site. Sold electricity is not reported as a sold product and the associated input and output data are not included in the inventory. The fuel consumption and emissions to air associated with the total heat production and the net electricity used on site were allocated to the paper production.;The following air emissions were reported in the study: Particulates, <2.5μm, Particulates, >2.5μm and <10μm, Particulates, >10μm, CO2 (fossil), CO2 (biomass) , CO , NOx (as NO2) , SOx (as SO2) .;For a more complete air emission profile, additional air emissions (beyond the ones listed above) were added for the combustion of the external fuels and internal using LCI datasets for combustion of different fuels as proxy. The air emissions were calculated based on the mix of the internal and external fuels in the study and more information about the fuel mix and the proxy are provided under "Extrapolations".

The process starts wih the reception of the recovered paper.

The process for the production of recycled fluting medium ends with the production of corrugated board base paper.
category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1702:Manufacture of corrugated paper and paperboard and of containers of paper a

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset has been extrapolated from respective regional geographies (RER). Data is coming from mills in Nordic countries and Germany. Data for main producers in Europe (Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Denmark, France, Germany, Hungary, Italy, the Netherlands, Poland, Romania, Serbia, Spain, Sweden and the United Kingdom)
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Average of present used technology;The stock preparation is done in accordance with a recipe for each paper grade and grammage. The grades of recovered paper are put on the conveyor to the pulper in the ratio mentioned in the recipe. In the pulper the blend of dry, baled paper is converted into a pumpable suspension of fibres. This is achieved by submerging the bales in water and agitating the mixture so that the paper is wetted and broken up to form a suspension. The pulp is then screened and cleaned. and may undergo a disperging treatment. The stock passes through one or two head boxes onto the paper machine, Wellenstoff can be a one ply or two ply product. Usually, a size press treatment with a starch solution is applied in-line on the paper machine in order to obtain sufficient strength and stiffness properties. The process ends with the production of corrugated board base paper.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been extrapolated from respective regional geographies (RER). Additional air emissions from the combustion of fossil fuels estimated based on industrial heating datasets from the ecoinvent database and matched as follows: light fuel oil and diesel: heat production, light fuel oil, at industrial furnace 1MW, Europe without Switzerland; heavy fuel oil: heat production, heavy fuel oil, at industrial furnace 1MW, Europe without Switzerland; Coal: heat production, at hard coal industrial furnace 1-10MW, Europe without Switzerland; natural gas, LPG and biogas and biosludges: heat production, natural gas, at industrial furnace >100kW, Europe without Switzerland; lignite: heat production, lignite briquette, at stove 5-15kW, Europe without Switzerland; Biofuel (bark. scrap wood. tall oil): heat production, wood chips from industry, at furnace 1000kW, CH; refused derived fuel, biomass: heat production, wood chips from post-consumer wood, at furnace 300kW Emissions of stemming from biogas were approximated with the combustion of natural gas, whereby CO2, CO and CH4 emissions stemming from biogas were modelled as non-fossil.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: This dataset has been extrapolated from respective regional geographies (RER). Data were collected from the producers by CCB (Cepi ContainerBoard)and FEFCO (European Federation of Corrugated Board Manufacturers) for the European Database for Corrugated Board Life Cycle Studies), checked by technical experts and reviewed by the Institut für Energie- und Umweltforschung Heidelberg (ifeu). The data for the production of Testliner and Wellenstoff were collected from mills, which together represent about 71 % of the total yearly production of corrugated base papers from recovered paper in Europe. Reference(s): FEFCO. 2021. European Database for Corrugated Board Life Cycle Studies 2021. Reference(s): https://www.fefco.org/sites/default/files/documents/2022-07-07_FEFCO%20LCA%202021.pdf, last acessed March 2023

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/unspecified

exchanges.description: Estimation based on fuel input data and emission factors from corresponding ecoinvent fuel combustion datasets (see "Extrapolations" comment). Internal fuels are represented by the calculated emissions but do not have the corresponding fuel input from technosphere, because they are supplied from within the system boundaries. The amounts of internal fuels used in the process are: Biogas and biosludge (0.266 GJ/t), Refuse derived fuel (RDF) (0.299GJ/t), other internal fuel (0.035 GJ/t). No proxy was available for the combustion of other internal fuels. Emissions from these internal energy generation processes are therefore only reflected in the key emission factors provided by the industry, other emissions constitute a data gap.

The amounts of internal fuels used in the process are: Biogas and biosludge (0.266 GJ/t), Refuse derived fuel (RDF) (0.299GJ/t), other internal fuel (0.035 GJ/t). No proxy was available for the combustion of other internal fuels. Emissions from these internal energy generation processes are therefore only reflected in the key emission factors provided by the industry, other emissions constitute a data gap.

exchanges.description: Estimation based on fuel input data and emission factors from corresponding ecoinvent fuel combustion datasets (see "Extrapolations" comment).
